articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Lao President
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Revolutionary Party and president of Laos.
					 The message said:
					
					 I would like to extend warm congratulations and comradely greetings to you on your 78th birthday.
					
					 Today, the Lao people are registering many successes in the struggle to defend the gains of the revolution, consolidate and develop the people's democratic system and carry out the decisions made at the 9th Congress of the People's Revolutionary Party under the correct leadership of the party headed by you.
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the parties, states and peoples of our two countries which forged and have developed on the basis of the common socialist idea would grow stronger as desired by the preceding leaders, I sincerely wish you good health, happiness and greater success in your responsible work.

articles.title: Candidates for SPA Deputies Nominated, Registered at All Constituencies
articles.content:
Candidates for SPA Deputies Nominated, Registered at All Constituencies
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Election Committee for the Election of the Deputies to the 13th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK Wednesday reported that candidates for the SPA deputies were nominated and registered at all constituencies of the DPRK.
					 The report said:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent an open letter to all voters throughout the country in which he announced that he decided to register as a candidate for deputy at Paektusan Constituency No. 111 for the election of the deputies to the 13th SPA of the DPRK. Afterwards, all other constituencies successfully nominated and registered the candidates for the deputies to the 13th SPA.
					
					 The meetings of the electorate for nominating candidates for the deputies to the 13th SPA of the DPRK and examining their qualifications nominated service personnel, workers, farmers, intellectuals and officials who are devoting themselves to the prosperity of the country and the happiness of the people, true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Un, as candidates for the deputies.
					
					 All the constituency election committees across the country registered the nominees as the candidates for the deputies to the SPA to be elected at relevant constituencies, according to the Rules on the Elections of Deputies to the People's Assemblies at All Levels.
					
					 The Central Election Committee reported that relevant constituency election committees correctly registered the candidates for the SPA deputies who were nominated at the meetings of the electorate of all constituencies across the country as candidates for the SPA deputies.

articles.title: Kang Sok Ju Meets European Politicians
articles.content:
Kang Sok Ju Meets European Politicians
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK Vice-Premier Kang Sok Ju met and had a talk with a delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe headed by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair, which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.

articles.title: European Politicians Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
European Politicians Visit Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe headed by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the immortal life of Kim Il Sung, the guests looked round historic relics preserved there with much care.
					
					 The delegation also toured the apartment houses for educators of Kim Il Sung University, Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Mirim Riding Club, Munsu Water Park, etc.

articles.title: DPRK's Rocket Launching Drills, Part of Military Power of Its Army: KPA Officer
articles.content:
DPRK's Rocket Launching Drills, Part of Military Power of Its Army: KPA Officer
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- An Pyong Min, an officer of the Korean People's Army (KPA), said, recalling that the KPA Strategic Force successfully carried out rocket launching drills recently according to its regular training plans:
					 The rockets accurately struck the targets in the designated waters without the slightest deviation, demonstrating the highest-ever rate of hits.
					
					 In fact, this is part of the tremendous military power of our army capable to strike at one blow a nuclear-powered aircraft carrier or a nuclear strategic bomber provoking the DPRK.
					
					 Problematic is that the U.S., frightened with the rocket launching drills, is making a fuss, terming them a "provocation" and "threat".
					
					 Groundlessly it is labeling them "a violation" of UN resolutions.
					
					 There is an old saying that criminals are sentenced to capital punishment even in a dream. Americans go despicably mad.
					
					 The U.S., taken aback by the DPRK's satellite launch for a peaceful purpose, branded it as "a long-range missile launch" and is now describing medium- and short-range rocket launching as "a grave threat". This shows that psychopathy, a chronic disease of the U.S., reaches the worst incurable stage.
					
					 This showed how densely they were engrained with the enmity to the DPRK and how much they were scared of the DPRK's rockets.
					
					 A club is fit for a mad wolf. 
					
					 As we already declared, if the U.S. persists in a smear campaign, not coming to its senses, we should mercilessly blow up the dens of wolves including the U.S. mainland through powerful attack rocket launching.
					
					 We will hold higher the slogan "Annihilate the U.S. imperialist aggressors, the sworn enemy of the Korean people!"

articles.title: I Will Hunt Bush before Any Others When War Breaks out: KPA Soldier
articles.content:
I Will Hunt Bush before Any Others When War Breaks out: KPA Soldier
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Ri Jong Gil, a private first class of the Korean People's Army (KPA), said upon hearing the statement of the spokesman for the Strategic Force of the KPA:
					 How thrilling! I feel as if strength was surging in me.
					
					 The moment the statement of the spokesman for the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army (KPA) was over, I rushed to the Korean martial art training ground and beat and headed targets in the spirit of wiping out a GI.
					
					 Americans, taken aback by the DPRK's rocket launching, complaining about its rockets and nuclear weapons, looked like cockroaches attacked by their killers. This is a shrill of despair and lamentation of the defeated.
					
					 It is necessary to launch rockets in succession till they come to their senses.
					
					 It was reported that some days ago, Bush who was like an animal with rare fur flew into south Korea and dared slander the DPRK, praising human scum as "heroes".
					
					 Bush is well known not only in the U.S. but in the world for his disposition of going on rampage. This wolf-like old man is living on bread crumbs thrown by children at a zoo of the U.S.
					
					 So, everybody refrains from meeting this wolf as it is apt to cause a scramble. But it is only south Korea which accorded to him cordial hospitality. 
					
					 Being a good marksman in my company, I will hunt Bush before any others when a war breaks out.
					
					 I am fully ready to hunt Bush and a military feat belongs to me.

articles.title: We Will Carry through Party's New Line of Developing Two Fronts Simultaneously: Shop Head of Steel Complex
articles.content:
We Will Carry through Party's New Line of Developing Two Fronts Simultaneously: Shop Head of Steel Complex
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- At the news of the rocket launching drills conducted  by the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army, the spirit of smelters is sky-high and steel production is rapidly jumping at the steel complex, said Jin Yong Il, a workshop head of the Chollima Steel Complex. 
					 He went on:
					
					 Hearing the news that rockets launched demonstrated the highest-ever rate of hits, we felt as if we had seen dens of evil reduced to ashes. GIs seem to be struck with fear.
					
					 Several medium- and short-range rockets, not long-range rockets, were launched this time but the U.S. is running helter-skelter, as if rockets had dropped over its mainland.
					
					 The U.S. termed the DPRK's regular rocket launching drills a "provocation" and "threat". It is the sworn enemy with whom the workers of the Kangson Steel Complex should settle accounts generation after generation.
					
					 The U.S. committed such unheard-of crimes as destroying everything precious in the land of Kangson in the 1950s and made desperate efforts to suffocate the economy of the DPRK for decades in the postwar period. Not content with this, it is groundlessly taking issue with the DPRK over its just self-defensive step. How can we pardon it?
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should be thrown into electric furnaces and eliminated from the surface of the earth as they are the root cause of all evils and misfortunes in the world.
					
					 We, workers of the  heroic Korea who have always emerged strong and victorious thanks to Songun, will more successfully implement our Party's line of developing the two fronts simultaneously, determined to bring down sledge hammers on the heads of the GIs as they have the worst habit in the world.

articles.title: It Is Hard to Tame Wolf: Tamer
articles.content:
It Is Hard to Tame Wolf: Tamer
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- U.S. Secretary of State Kerry's recent mud-slinging at the DPRK touches off towering hatred and resentment among Koreans, said Ma Hye Song, tamer at the National Circus. 
					 Ma noted:
					
					 One must understand what the U.S. is like if one is to know the reason why it is running so desperate with repugnance towards the DPRK like a psychopath. 
					
					 People pay attention to the fact that lots of hills and valleys in the land of the U.S. are good habitats for wolves. Probably, Kerry must have wolf-like disposition as he grew up under their influence. 
					
					 Great irony is that Kerry branded the DPRK as "a cruel country, wicked and evil place." 
					
					 The U.S., watching for a chance to hurt others, is letting loose so malignant invectives in a bid to persistently bar the DPRK from having access to nuclear weapons and launching rockets. This was prompted by its vicious attempt to reduce the DPRK to a dehorned sheep. 
					
					 Americans' groundless mud-slinging at the DPRK only revealed their mean way of thinking and personality once again. 
					
					 Looking back on history, people have tamed all creatures including dolphin, goat, pig, tiger and lion. 
					
					 However, there is no one who has ever tamed brutal, cruel and blood-thirsty wolves. There will no one in the future, too. 
					
					 If a wolf loses taste of blood and eats grass, imitating moo of sheep, then it will not be a wolf any longer.
					
					 A club is fit for a mad wolf and arms fit for the wolf-like U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Miserable End of U.S. Will Come Earlier Due to Political Imbeciles
articles.content:
Miserable End of U.S. Will Come Earlier Due to Political Imbeciles
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Recently Bush met in a dark corner of Seoul with human scum, who defected to the south, leaving genuine society of the DPRK. 
					 At the meeting Bush praised the human scum wandering about without any proper shelter as "heroes". "Moved to tears" by this gesture, these good-for-nothings extolled Bush as "a hero". 
					
					 Ridiculing this, Pak Chang Un, section chief of the State Invention Bureau, said:
					
					 Bush was known to be a fool after being scolded in the political circle of the U.S. for his disposition as a rogue, dull political sense and lack of logical vision. 
					
					 Wicked Bush vociferated about "human rights records" in the DPRK before the human scum. He was busy letting loose a whole string of reckless remarks slinging mud at Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses, laying bare his true colors as a political under-wit bereft of any elementary knowledge about it. 
					
					 No proper words could be heard from Bush steeped in repugnance towards others and keen on injustice and evils.
					
					 No matter who becomes the President of the U.S., the bad habit of the U.S. finding fault with others can never change, as clarified by the spokesman for the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army in his statement. This is quite obvious. 
					
					 It is hard reality that the theory of U.S. collapse is spreading worldwide and its position as a "superpower" is radically sinking. The end of the U.S. will come earlier as long as the White House is staffed with such politically imbeciles who regard that reality as fatalistic.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists' Backbiting Snubbed
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists' Backbiting Snubbed
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Gil, head of a sub-workteam of the Jonsung Farm in Unsan County, North Phyongan Province, accused the U.S. of groundlessly hurling mud at the DPRK over  the regular rocket launching drills of the Korean People's Army.
					 He said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are the worst villains in the world as they do the worst things only. Do they have the face to point an accusing finger at the DPRK?
					
					 It is better to throw a basketful of compost into their mouths.
					
					 Still fresh in the memory of farmers are the crimes of the U.S. imperialists who destroyed the fertile fields of the country by indiscriminately dropping shells and bombs and using biological weapons in the past Fatherland Liberation War. Running high are our bitter anger and resentment at the wolf-like U.S. imperialists who desperately blocked the import of fertilizers and plastic sheets during the Arduous March, forced march.
					
					 That is why we are cutting off grass in the spirit of dismembering GIs and driving tractors to plough paddy and non-paddy fields in the spirit of pulling down their dens.
					
					 For us rice is like bullets and shells for wiping out the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 I will register bigger success in agricultural production, keeping pace with soldiers of the People's Army winning victory in defending the country.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists Had Better Behave Themselves
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists Had Better Behave Themselves: Student
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Song Kyong Jin, a student of the Life Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University, said upon hearing a statement of the spokesman for the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army:
					The U.S. imperialists dared term the DPRK's just self-defensive drills "provocation" and cried out for "sanctions" at a meeting held in the back room. Not content with this, they vociferously labeled the DPRK a "country of evils" at a formal meeting this time. These behaviors touch off a thousand-fold bitterer resentment among us.
					
					The U.S., the root cause of all evils, is again talking about evils like a crow on a dead body.
					
					The U.S. is acting like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger.
					
					How can we describe in a word the misfortune and pain the Korean people have undergone for several decades due to the U.S. imperialists as they divided the Korean peninsula into two parts and deprived south Korean students of opportunity of learning due to drills for a war of aggression.
					
					The more groundlessly the U.S. accuses the DPRK, the severer punishment it will face.
					
					The U.S. imperialists had better stop running riot. We will give a miserable death to them.
					
					No matter how malignantly the U.S. imperialists may slander Songun Korea regarding it as a thorn in their flesh, we, students of this land who value justice and truth, will dynamically wield our pens on behalf of human conscience and progress like rockets for reducing the U.S. citadel to ashes.

articles.title: WPK's Slogan Helpful to Revolutionary Cause of Juche
articles.content:
WPK's Slogan Helpful to Revolutionary Cause of Juche
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- It has been 40 years since leader Kim Jong Il advanced the slogan "Let us produce, study and live like the anti-Japanese guerrillas!" in March Juche 63 (1974) when the work for modeling the whole society on Kimilsungism came to the fore in the DPRK.
					 This is a strategic slogan of the Workers' Party of Korea intended to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche by applying the Paektu traditions in all spheres of the revolution and construction. It reflected the strong will of Kim Jong Il to hold fast to and carry forward the revolutionary traditions.
					
					 After putting up the slogan, he wisely led the work to make the Paektu revolutionary spirit spread in all sectors of socialist construction. Consequently, the golden age of the WPK was ushered in with a radical turn brought in the people's ideological viewpoint, working traits and way of life.
					
					 The Arduous March in the 1990s was a striking demonstration of the invincible vitality of the traditions established in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. The army and people in the DPRK gave full play to the might of Korean-style socialism with the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the spirit of self-reliance and revolutionary optimism and the spirit of overcoming difficulties, displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 All the Korean people are now working hard, with steadfast faith in socialism and optimistic about rosy future. The fact proves the purity and magnetic power of the Paektu revolutionary traditions.

articles.title: New Scientific Successes Achieved in Agriculture
articles.content:
New Scientific Successes Achieved in Agriculture
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Academy of Agricultural Science have registered many successes conducive to boosting agricultural production.
					 The Crops Cultivation Institute under the academy has invented new farming methods and techniques.
					
					 Among them is a method of forcing rice seedlings.
					
					 The method gives full play to the biological character of cold-bed rice seedlings with less materials and labor saved while reducing fertilizer consumption by 60 percent and increasing per-hectare yield.
					
					 A method using potato sprouts makes it possible to get tens of seedlings from a potato.
					
					 A method based on green manure plants is also effective in boosting rice and maize production with less consumption of fertilizer.
					
					 The Plant Preservation Institute has developed new microbial agrochemicals.
					
					 One of them is microbial herbicide capable of exterminating more than 80 percent of barnyard grass, giving no adverse effect on the growth of paddy rice.
					
					 The institute is helping agrochemicals production bases now under construction in each province put the production of agricultural antibiotic on an industrial basis.
					
					 The antibiotic is also applicable to vegetables.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Joint Military Drills
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Joint Military Drills
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills being staged by the United States and south Korea are provocative saber-rattling simulating a preemptive nuclear attack upon the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The focus of the joint military drills is directed to increasing the combined and joint operation capabilities of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and units of the south Korean army and finally rounding off all the preparations for a war as required by the scenario for mounting a preemptive attack upon the north.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the warmongers are seeking to apply their "tailored deterrence strategy" to the on-going drills for the first time and to prove its effectiveness.
					
					 The "tailored deterrence strategy" is a dangerous war scenario which calls for mobilizing all military means including nuclear weapons and making a preemptive attack on the north after dividing somebody's posture of nuclear action into the phase of threat, the phase of imminent use and the phase of using nukes, etc.
					
					 It is the height of shamelessness that they are painting such drills for aggression as "defensive" now that they clearly assume the nature of preemptive attack on the north and all-out war.
					
					 The joint military drills are undisguised exercises for a nuclear war against the DPRK because they are not "annual defensive drills" to cope with "threat and provocation" from someone but for posing a serious military threat to it while bringing the tension on the Korean peninsula to an extreme phase and, at the same time, vitiating the atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving the independent reunification.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop letting loose rhetoric about "defensive drills" and halt at once Key Resolve and Foal Eagle as unanimously demanded by the Korean nation.

articles.title: Halt to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills Demanded by Korean in U.S.
articles.content:
Halt to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills Demanded by Korean in U.S.
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A member of editorial board of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., issued an article on Tuesday demanding a halt to the U.S.-south Korea joint military drills.
					 The article noted that the U.S. is escalating military tensions while staging the joint military drills for a nuclear war against the north by mobilizing nuclear force.
					
					 The U.S. is terming the rocket launching drills of the north a "breach of resolutions of the UN Security Council", while wantonly violating the Armistice Agreement, the article charged.
					
					 The U.S. is not entitled to talk about this, it said, and went on:
					
					 The 40 odd year-long colonial rule over Korea by the Japanese imperialists was a product of the international politically-motivated operation faked up by the conclusion of the "Taft-Katsura Treaty" and the Korean war was a war of aggression ignited by the U.S. by inveigling its satellite forces in it.
					
					 The U.S. has no face to say about the north's action.
					
					 It is just the U.S. which has made lies to justify its crimes of killing innocent civilians after invading Iraq, Afghanistan, Libya and other countries in Mideast.
					
					 The U.S. is talking about the "denuclearization of the north" while fostering the war crisis by introducing Columbus, a nuclear submarine, in Pusan Port of south Korea on March 3 for the joint military drills. This is a deceptive behavior.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop the joint military drills with the U.S. and have the stand of placing the nation above outsiders, though belatedly, the article concluded.

articles.title: Unearthing of Remains of Civilian Victims Called for in South Korea
articles.content:
Unearthing of Remains of Civilian Victims Called for in South Korea
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Society of Bereaved Families of Civilian Victims before and after the Korean War released a statement on March 4 urging the regime to take a measure for unearthing the remains of civilians who were massacred during the war, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 Recalling that the society urged the "government" and the "National Assembly" in 2009 to find out and bury the remains of the civilians killed during the war, the statement blamed them for failing to do so till now.
					
					 It is a crime of killing those victims again not to find out their remains as they met a grievous death, the statement held.
					
					 It urged the present regime to enact a special law for unearthing and burying the remains of the civilian victims, though belatedly.

articles.title: University Part-time Workers Go on General Strike
articles.content:
University Part-time Workers Go on General Strike
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- University part-time workers in Seoul under the Seoul, Kyongin branch of the Public Transport Trade Union of south Korea went on a general strike on Monday, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People. 
					 It was participated in by part-time workers of 14 universities including Korea University, Kyunghee University, Yonsei University, Ehwa Women's University, Sogang University, Hongik University and Duksong Women's College.
					
					 They held a meeting at Korea University. 
					
					 Speakers said there that the  oppressed part-time workers almost at all universities in Seoul turned out in their actions to declare that they are no longer slaves but human beings.
					
					 They urged the universities' sides to meet the demands of workers including stable employment, wage hike and improved labor conditions. 
					
					 The internet paper Voice of People on Tuesday carried an editorial in support of the general strike of the part-time workers. 
					
					 The editorial said:
					
					 Universities and hiring bodies signed modern day slave contracts, threatening the part-time workers' right to existence. 
					
					 It was quite natural that the workers went on a general strike. 
					
					 Universities' sides should stop actions of bringing profits to the hiring bodies and guarantee the part-time workers' right to existence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Italy, Zambia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Italy, Zambia
Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- An Italian organization and Zambian paper devoted special write-ups to the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity posted on its website on February 26 an article titled "72nd anniversary of birth of Comrade Kim Jong Il" illustrated with the portrait of President Kim Il Sung and photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of the Korean revolution, in 1942.
					
					 He was an ardent revolutionary and patriot, who devoted his all to accomplishing the cause of socialism, defending the sovereignty of the country and its peace and achieving reunification.
					
					 He proved the sure victory of socialism before the whole world while carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Kim Il Sung with indomitable will and made forced march for field guidance for the people till the last moments of his life.
					
					 The Zambian paper Post on February 20 carried an article saying that Kim Jong Il established state machinery with the National Defence Commission as its pivot and provided a firm legal guarantee for the Songun politics, thus laying a foundation for the DPRK to eternally prosper.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita cumpleanos de Choummaly Sayasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita cumpleanos de Choummaly Sayasone
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 6 un mensaje de felicitacion a Choummaly Sayasone, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y Presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Con motivo de su 78o cumpleanos, le extiendo calidas felicitaciones y saludo camaraderil.
					
					Hoy en dia, bajo la correcta guia del PPRL encabezado por Vd., el pueblo laosiano alcanza muchos exitos en la lucha por defender las conquistas revolucionarias, consolidar y desarrollar el regimen popular democratico y materializar la resolucion del 9o congreso del partido.
					
					Convencido de que conforme al deseo de los lideres antecesores, seguiran consolidandose y desarrollandose mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos, Estados y pueblos de nuestros dos paises que han sido establecidas y desarrolladas a base del ideal comun del socialismo, le deseo de todo corazon a Vd. la buena salud y felicidad y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades.

articles.title: Informacion de Comite Electoral Central
articles.content:
Informacion de Comite Electoral Central
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Comite Electoral Central de las elecciones de los diputados para la decimotercera Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico el dia 5 una informacion sobre el hecho de que en todas las circunscripciones electorales ya fueron elegidos y registrados los candidatos de los diputados.
					La nota senala:
					
					Despues de que el Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio un mensaje abierto a todos los electores del pais, a traves de lo cual anuncio su decision de inscribirse en la circunscripcion 111 de Paektusan para las elecciones de los diputados, todas las demas circunscripciones realizaron con exito las elecciones y registros de los candidatos de dichos diputados.
					
					En las reuniones de los electores para elegir a los candidatos y evaluar sus calificaciones, fueron elegidos como los candidatos de diputados los militares del Ejercito Popular, obreros, campesinos, intelectuales y funcionarios quienes en pleno acato a la direccion del Mariscal sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun, se esfuerzan abnegadamente por la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Todos los comites electorales distritales del pais desarrollaron las labores para registrar a los candidatos elegidos segun la ley sobre las elecciones de diputados de las asambleas populares a todos niveles como los candidatos de diputados a la APS a ser elegidos en las circunscripciones electorales correspondientes.
					
					El Comite Electoral Central informo de que todos los comites electorales distritales registraron exactamente a los candidatos de diputados a la APS elegidos en las reuniones de electores.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun califica Key Resolve y Foal Eagle de ejercicios de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun califica Key Resolve y Foal Eagle de ejercicios de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- Los ejercicios militares conjuntos Key Resolve y Foal Eagle resultan un alboroto belico de caracter provocativo que supone el ataque preventivo nuclear contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Insiste el rotativo Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual divulgado este jueves y continua: 
					
					Los presentes simulacros enfocan a elevar la capacidad de operaciones conjuntas de tropas norteamericanas y surcoreanas conforme al intento de ataque preventivo anti-RPDC y perfeccionar finalmente los preparativos de guerra. 
					
					Lo mas grave es que los belicistas intentan aplicar por primera vez la "estrategia del disuasivo de forma de ajuste" y revisar su eficiencia. 
					
					Esta estrategia especifica la crisis nuclear de alguien en tres etapas: la de amenaza, la de inminencia de uso y la de uso. Segun ese guion de guerra muy aventurero, todos los medios militares se movilizaran para asestar el ataque preventivo contra la RPDC. 
					
					Sin embargo, los belicistas describen esos ejercicios de guerra de agresion como "entrenamientos defensivos", lo cual es el climax del cinismo.
					
					Los presentes simulacros no son "ejercicios defensivos y anuales" para hacer frente a la "amenaza y provocacion" de alguien, sino una abierta maniobra de agresion encaminada a ejercer la amenaza militar a la RPDC, agravando extremadamente la situacion de la Peninsula Corea, y al mismo tiempo, hacer fracasar el ambiente favorable a la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y a la reunificacion independiente y provocar la guerra nuclear contra la RPDC. 
					
					EE.UU. debe parar de inmediato los simulacros Key Resolve y Foal Eagle, segun la unanime demanda de la nacion coreana, en lugar de describirlos como "entrenamientos defensivos".
